Name: Ajdabiya
Description: Ajdabiya is a city in northeastern Libya, known for its role as a major junction for transportation and commerce between the eastern and western parts of the country.

Name: Al Jabal al Akhdar
Description: Al Jabal al Akhdar is a mountain range in northeastern Libya, with fertile lands and a Mediterranean climate, making it a key agricultural area.

Name: Al Kufrah
Description: Al Kufrah is a desert region in southeastern Libya, known for its role in the oil industry and as a key area for oasis towns.

Name: Benghazi
Description: Benghazi is the second-largest city in Libya, located in the northeastern part of the country, known for its historical significance and economic importance.

Name: Derna
Description: Derna is a coastal city in northeastern Libya, known for its scenic views, historical ruins, and strategic location along the Mediterranean.

Name: Fezzan
Description: Fezzan is a large desert region in the southwestern part of Libya, known for its vast desert landscapes, ancient ruins, and strategic location near the border with Chad and Niger.

Name: Jufra
Description: Jufra is a desert region in central Libya, known for its historical sites and oil reserves.

Name: Murzuq
Description: Murzuq is a region in southwestern Libya, known for its historical importance and desert landscapes.

Name: Tripoli
Description: Tripoli is the capital and largest city of Libya, located in the northwest, known as the country s political, economic, and cultural center.

Name: Zliten
Description: Zliten is a coastal city in northwestern Libya, known for its agricultural importance and proximity to Tripoli.
